title: SoC RTVF 398-0-21 Symposium: Issues in RTVF

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
RTVF 398-0 Sec. 21 Issues in RTVF: Nostalgia and Popular Culture, TTh 3:00-5:20, AMS Auditorium
Mimi White

"Nostalgia" is a medical condition, an feeling, an attitude, a style. It may be deeply personal, but may equally be provoked publically, through objects, images, sounds, and stories. There are nostalgia films, and films that trigger nostalgia?and these are not necessarily the same thing. Nostalgia is about longing and the past?remembered and forgotten, actual and imagined?but it is not quite the same as history, memory, or trauma. This class explores some of the prominent ideas about nostalgia, especially ones developed in the context of film, television, and cultural studies. The class considers nostalgia in popular media, emphasizing the kinds of aesthetic/narrative practices that are most liable to be considered "nostalgic." Media texts include: Midnight in Paris, American Graffiti, and Pleasantville, and television programs such as Mad Men and Pushing Daisies.

Class requirements: Attendance at screenings/lectures; participation in class discussion; weekly reading assignments and assigned reading responses; two short papers; take-home final.

Required reading packet will be approx. $30.00
Depending on what students choose to write about, they may have to make additional investment to access specific films/TV
